intro: Boehmeria malabarica var. neglecta, commonly known as the Malabar nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of nettles. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. This variant is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
